title: Low priority queue finished! Hurrah!
body:
First game back from low priority queue after telstra techs have fixed the shitty copper, 2nd pick ready to go and BAM, I get disconnected from server.
5 minute lockout.
Riot please.

replies.body: i have to be very cautious when playing a match in lol because if i has so much as leave the game for about a minute i will receive a 20 minute Buster, only because i had connections issues around Urf mode since my siblings were streaming football and stuff like that which really screwed over my connection. i wish riot would have like a thing for it so you lose 5 minutes on it for every month you go without getting a buster or something like that because i don't want to have to worry about having to wait almost half an hour only to play a game that lasts half an hour. I know it's meant to punish people but it seems little to no effort was put into the actual buster itself. it's kinda like Riot is just saying you get a buster here are your choices: A) wait half an hour before you play every single one of your matches for eternity, or B) Leave league of legends and never return.

I think leaverbuster is an important system, dont get me wrong.

But I also feel like these DC issues make me the dolphin in the tuna net. Unfortunate collateral of the true intent of the system.

The system itself isn't that bad it just feels as though little effort is actually being put into it. if they were to make it so if you were afk for more then a quarter of the match's length then you'd get a warning but if did it again then should you be placed in low priority
